definition: lit. to fire pots and smelt metal/fig. to educate
to cultivate one's mind/to build character

sentences.english: Theme living room wall calligraphy wall picture molding with a burglary of each person.
sentences.chinese: 客厅主题墙上的墨宝挂画陶冶着每一位入室者。

sentences.english: She read the best authors in an attempt to cultivate her mind.
sentences.chinese: 她为陶冶情操而阅读最优秀作家的作品。
这是一本陶冶情操的书。

sentences.english: Works of taste can refine the mind.
sentences.chinese: 高雅的作品能陶冶心灵。

sentences.english: She reads classic novels in an attempt to cultivate her minds.
sentences.chinese: 她为了陶冶情操而阅读经典著作。

sentences.english: Reading can cultivate people's temperament, edify sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 阅读能培养人的性情，陶冶情操。

sentences.english: Art will become clear after being edified.
sentences.chinese: 艺术经过陶冶才能变得清明。

sentences.english: Music is relaxing and is also a form of communication.
sentences.chinese: 音乐既可以令人陶冶性情，亦是人类的共通语言。

sentences.english: A. Build me a son whose heart will be clear, whose goal will be high;
sentences.chinese: 请陶冶我的儿子，使他的心地纯洁，目标高超。

sentences.english: They tried to edify the child with music.
sentences.chinese: 他们试图用音乐陶冶这孩子。

sentences.english: The Prince grew up assertive that a long nose was a affection of great adorableness.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的陶冶下，王子对大鼻子是美的象征坚信无疑。

sentences.english: This software edify sentiment while giving your art enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 本软件陶冶情操的同时给您艺术的享受。

sentences.english: To vitalize education depends on schools; to mould talents depends on excellent teachers.
sentences.chinese: 教育振兴期学校，人才陶冶仰良师。

sentences.english: According to him, fishing can constitute an activity conducive to the cultivation of one''s temperament and to one''s health, at once physical and psychological.
sentences.chinese: 钓鱼是一项能够陶冶性情的运动，有益于身心健康。

sentences.english: To cultivate students' minds of compassionate, loving and caring attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 陶冶学生性情，使其仁民爱物。

sentences.english: First of all, university education can help student cultivate sentiments.
sentences.chinese: 首先，大学教育可以帮助学生陶冶情操。

definition: to cultivate one's mind/to build character
to cultivate the heart and nurture the character (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation
one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
to exert a gradual influence/to nurture/a corrupting influence
to sample/to taste/to appreciate/one's taste (i.e. in music, literature, fashion, food and drink etc)/good taste
